verses.kjv: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh, which is called the Passover.
verses.web: Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
verses.ct: The Festival of Unleavened Bread — also known as Passover — was getting close.

verses.kjv: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.
verses.web: The chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death, for they feared the people.
verses.ct: The chief priests and the scribes were looking for a way to kill Jesus, but they were afraid of how the people might react.

verses.kjv: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.
verses.web: Satan entered into Judas, who was also called Iscariot, who was counted with the twelve.
verses.ct: Then Satan entered into Judas, the one called Iscariot, who was one of the 12 disciples.

verses.kjv: And he went his way, and communed with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray him unto them.
verses.web: He went away, and talked with the chief priests and captains about how he might deliver him to them.
verses.ct: Judas went and met with the chief priests and the temple guards to discuss how he could hand Jesus over to them.

verses.kjv: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.
verses.web: They were glad, and agreed to give him money.
verses.ct: They were thrilled and agreed to pay him money for it.

verses.kjv: And he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.
verses.web: He consented, and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them in the absence of the multitude.
verses.ct: Judas accepted the deal and began watching for the right moment to betray Jesus when no crowd was around.

verses.kjv: Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.
verses.web: The day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed.
verses.ct: Then the day of Unleavened Bread arrived — the day when the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.

verses.kjv: And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare us the passover, that we may eat.
verses.web: Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”
verses.ct: Jesus sent Peter and John ahead, saying, "Go and prepare the Passover meal for us so we can eat together."

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?
verses.web: They said to him, “Where do you want us to prepare?”
verses.ct: They asked him, "Where do you want us to prepare it?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.
verses.web: He said to them, “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.
verses.ct: He told them, "When you enter the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house he enters.

verses.kjv: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, The Master saith unto thee, Where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?
verses.web: Tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?” ’
verses.ct: Tell the owner of the house, 'The Teacher asks you: Where is the guest room where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?'

verses.kjv: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready.
verses.web: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”
verses.ct: He'll show you a large upstairs room, already furnished. Prepare the meal there."

verses.kjv: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.
verses.web: They went, found things as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover.
verses.ct: They went and found everything exactly as Jesus had told them, and they prepared the Passover meal.

verses.kjv: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.
verses.web: When the hour had come, he sat down with the twelve apostles.
verses.ct: When the time came, Jesus sat down at the table with his 12 apostles.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:
verses.web: He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer,
verses.ct: He said to them, "I have deeply longed to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

verses.kjv: For I say unto you, I will not any more eat thereof, until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God.
verses.web: for I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in God’s Kingdom.”
verses.ct: I'm telling you, I won't eat it again until it finds its fulfillment in the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, Take this, and divide it among yourselves:
verses.web: He received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said, “Take this, and share it among yourselves,
verses.ct: Then he took a cup, gave thanks to God, and said, "Take this and share it among yourselves.

verses.kjv: For I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.
verses.web: for I tell you, I will not drink at all again from the fruit of the vine, until God’s Kingdom comes.”
verses.ct: I'm telling you, I won't drink from the fruit of the vine again until the kingdom of God comes."

verses.kjv: And he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake it, and gave unto them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me.
verses.web: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke, and gave it to them, saying, “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.”
verses.ct: Then he took bread, gave thanks, broke it, and handed it to them, saying, "This is my body, given for you. Do this to remember me."

verses.kjv: Likewise also the cup after supper, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood, which is shed for you.
verses.web: Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.
verses.ct: In the same way, after supper he took the cup and said, "This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

verses.kjv: But, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table.
verses.web: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.
verses.ct: But look — the hand of the one who will betray me is right here at this table with me.

verses.kjv: And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!
verses.web: The Son of Man indeed goes, as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!”
verses.ct: The Son of Man will go down the path that has been determined for him, but how terrible it will be for the man who betrays him!"

verses.kjv: And they began to enquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.
verses.web: They began to question among themselves, which of them it was who would do this thing.
verses.ct: The disciples began asking each other which one of them could possibly do such a thing.

verses.kjv: And there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.
verses.web: A dispute also arose among them, which of them was considered to be greatest.
verses.ct: An argument also broke out among them about which of them should be considered the greatest.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors.
verses.web: He said to them, “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "The kings of the nations lord it over their people, and those in authority over them call themselves 'benefactors.'

verses.kjv: But ye shall not be so: but he that is greatest among you, let him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.
verses.web: But not so with you. But one who is the greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.
verses.ct: But that's not how it should be with you. Instead, the greatest among you should act like the youngest, and the leader should act like a servant.

verses.kjv: For whether is greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth? is not he that sitteth at meat? but I am among you as he that serveth.
verses.web: For who is greater, one who sits at the table, or one who serves? Isn’t it he who sits at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
verses.ct: Think about it — who's greater, the one sitting at the table or the one serving the food? Obviously the one at the table. But I am among you as one who serves.

verses.kjv: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.
verses.web: But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.
verses.ct: You are the ones who have stood by me through my trials.

verses.kjv: And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me;
verses.web: I confer on you a kingdom, even as my Father conferred on me,
verses.ct: So I grant you a kingdom, just as my Father granted one to me,

verses.kjv: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.web: that you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”
verses.ct: so that you will eat and drink at my table in my kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the 12 tribes of Israel."

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desired to have you, that he may sift you as wheat:
verses.web: The Lord said, “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have all of you, that he might sift you as wheat,
verses.ct: The Lord said, "Simon, Simon, listen — Satan has demanded permission to sift all of you like wheat.

verses.kjv: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.
verses.web: but I prayed for you, that your faith wouldn’t fail. You, when once you have turned again, establish your brothers.”
verses.ct: But I have prayed for you, that your faith won't fail. And when you have turned back, strengthen your brothers."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.
verses.web: He said to him, “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”
verses.ct: Peter said to him, "Lord, I'm ready to go with you to prison and even to death!"

verses.kjv: And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.
verses.web: He said, “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "I'm telling you, Peter — the rooster won't crow today before you have denied 3 times that you even know me."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing? And they said, Nothing.
verses.web: He said to them, “When I sent you out without purse, wallet, and sandals, did you lack anything?” They said, “Nothing.”
verses.ct: Then he asked them, "When I sent you out without a purse, a bag, or sandals, did you lack anything?" They answered, "Nothing."

verses.kjv: Then said he unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take it, and likewise his scrip: and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment, and buy one.
verses.web: Then he said to them, “But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.
verses.ct: He said, "But now, if you have a purse, take it — and a bag too. If you don't have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one.

verses.kjv: For I say unto you, that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me, And he was reckoned among the transgressors: for the things concerning me have an end.
verses.web: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ For that which concerns me has an end.”
verses.ct: I'm telling you, what was written about me must be fulfilled: 'He was counted among the criminals.' Everything written about me is reaching its conclusion."

verses.kjv: And they said, Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said unto them, It is enough.
verses.web: They said, “Lord, behold, here are two swords.” He said to them, “That is enough.”
verses.ct: They said, "Lord, look — here are 2 swords." He replied, "That's enough."

verses.kjv: And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.
verses.web: He came out and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.
verses.ct: Jesus left and went to the Mount of Olives, as he usually did. His disciples followed him.

verses.kjv: And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.
verses.web: When he was at the place, he said to them, “Pray that you don’t enter into temptation.”
verses.ct: When he reached the place, he told them, "Pray that you won't fall into temptation."

verses.kjv: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone’s cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,
verses.web: He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s throw, and he knelt down and prayed,
verses.ct: Then he pulled away from them about a stone's throw, knelt down, and prayed.

verses.kjv: Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.
verses.web: saying, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”
verses.ct: "Father, if you are willing, take this cup away from me. But not my will — yours be done."

verses.kjv: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.
verses.web: An angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.
verses.ct: An angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.

verses.kjv: And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
verses.web: Being in agony he prayed more earnestly. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground.
verses.ct: In deep agony, he prayed even more intensely, and his sweat fell to the ground like great drops of blood.

verses.kjv: And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,
verses.web: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples, and found them sleeping because of grief,
verses.ct: When he got up from praying and went back to his disciples, he found them asleep, exhausted from grief.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.
verses.web: and said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”
verses.ct: He said to them, "Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray so that you won't fall into temptation."

verses.kjv: And while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them, and drew near unto Jesus to kiss him.
verses.web: While he was still speaking, behold, a multitude, and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.
verses.ct: While he was still speaking, a crowd appeared. Leading them was Judas, one of the 12, and he walked up to Jesus to kiss him.

verses.kjv: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?
verses.web: But Jesus said to him, “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
verses.ct: But Jesus said to him, "Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?"

verses.kjv: When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?
verses.web: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
verses.ct: When the disciples around him saw what was about to happen, they asked, "Lord, should we fight with our swords?"

verses.kjv: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.
verses.web: A certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.
verses.ct: One of them struck the high priest's servant and cut off his right ear.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said, Suffer ye thus far. And he touched his ear, and healed him.
verses.web: But Jesus answered, “Let me at least do this”—and he touched his ear, and healed him.
verses.ct: But Jesus said, "Stop — no more of this!" Then he touched the man's ear and healed him.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus said unto the chief priests, and captains of the temple, and the elders, which were come to him, Be ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and staves?
verses.web: Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and elders, who had come against him, “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?
verses.ct: Jesus said to the chief priests, temple guards, and elders who had come for him, "Have you come out with swords and clubs as if I were a criminal?

verses.kjv: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.
verses.web: When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn’t stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”
verses.ct: Every day I was with you in the temple and you never laid a hand on me. But this is your hour — the hour when darkness reigns."

verses.kjv: Then took they him, and led him, and brought him into the high priest’s house. And Peter followed afar off.
verses.web: They seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed from a distance.
verses.ct: They seized Jesus and led him away to the high priest's house. Peter followed at a distance.

verses.kjv: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.
verses.web: When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and had sat down together, Peter sat among them.
verses.ct: They lit a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together. Peter sat down among them.

verses.kjv: But a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and earnestly looked upon him, and said, This man was also with him.
verses.web: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said, “This man also was with him.”
verses.ct: A servant girl noticed him sitting by the firelight. She stared at him closely and said, "This man was with him too."

verses.kjv: And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.
verses.web: He denied Jesus, saying, “Woman, I don’t know him.”
verses.ct: But Peter denied it, saying, "Woman, I don't know him."

verses.kjv: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.
verses.web: After a little while someone else saw him, and said, “You also are one of them!” But Peter answered, “Man, I am not!”
verses.ct: A little later, someone else saw him and said, "You're one of them too!" Peter replied, "Man, I am not!"

verses.kjv: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this fellow also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.
verses.web: After about one hour passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Truly this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!”
verses.ct: About an hour later, another person insisted, "There's no doubt — this man was with him. He's a Galilean!"

verses.kjv: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.
verses.web: But Peter said, “Man, I don’t know what you are talking about!” Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
verses.ct: Peter said, "Man, I don't know what you're talking about!" Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

verses.kjv: And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
verses.web: The Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord’s word, how he said to him, “Before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.”
verses.ct: The Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. Then Peter remembered what the Lord had said to him: "Before the rooster crows today, you will deny me 3 times."

verses.kjv: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.
verses.web: He went out, and wept bitterly.
verses.ct: Peter went outside and wept bitterly.

verses.kjv: And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and smote him.
verses.web: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.
verses.ct: The men guarding Jesus mocked him and beat him.

verses.kjv: And when they had blindfolded him, they struck him on the face, and asked him, saying, Prophesy, who is it that smote thee?
verses.web: Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”
verses.ct: They blindfolded him, hit him in the face, and taunted him: "Prophesy! Who hit you?"

verses.kjv: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him.
verses.web: They spoke many other things against him, insulting him.
verses.ct: They hurled all kinds of insults at him.

verses.kjv: And as soon as it was day, the elders of the people and the chief priests and the scribes came together, and led him into their council, saying,
verses.web: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people were gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying,
verses.ct: At daybreak, the council of elders — both chief priests and scribes — assembled and had Jesus brought before them.

verses.kjv: Art thou the Christ? tell us. And he said unto them, If I tell you, ye will not believe:
verses.web: “If you are the Christ, tell us.” But he said to them, “If I tell you, you won’t believe,
verses.ct: They demanded, "If you are the Christ, tell us." He answered, "If I tell you, you won't believe me.

verses.kjv: And if I also ask you, ye will not answer me, nor let me go.
verses.web: and if I ask, you will in no way answer me or let me go.
verses.ct: And if I ask you a question, you won't answer me or let me go.

verses.kjv: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.
verses.web: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”
verses.ct: But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God."

verses.kjv: Then said they all, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said unto them, Ye say that I am.
verses.web: They all said, “Are you then the Son of God?” He said to them, “You say it, because I am.”
verses.ct: They all asked, "So you are the Son of God?" He replied, "You say that I am."

verses.kjv: And they said, What need we any further witness? for we ourselves have heard of his own mouth.
verses.web: They said, “Why do we need any more witness? For we ourselves have heard from his own mouth!”
verses.ct: They said, "Why do we need any more testimony? We've heard it straight from his own mouth!"
